intro: Microstylis muelleri, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, preferring moist soils. Microstylis muelleri is often found in swampy areas and is adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic conditions.
